thread.title: Red Bulls closer to securing Eastern Conference crown
thread.title_full: Red Bulls closer to securing Eastern Conference crown

title: Red Bulls closer to securing Eastern Conference crown
text:
Red Bulls closer to securing Eastern Conference crown October 8, 2015 Last updated: Thursday, October 8, 2015, 1:20 AM THE ASSOCIATED PRESS | Print 
HARRISON â€” Sacha Kljestan and Lloyd Sam scored to help the Red Bulls beat the Montreal Impact, 2-1, on Wednesday night. 
New York (16-9-6) will secure the Eastern Conference regular-season title with a win or tie in either of its two remaining matches. 
The Red Bulls are three points ahead of Los Angeles and four in front of FC Dallas in the race for the overall lead. 
Ambroise Oyongo was shown a red card for a hand ball on what otherwise would have been a goal by Bradley Wright-Phillip in the 15th minute, leaving Montreal (12-13-6) a man down. 
Kljestan put away the ensuing penalty kick. 
Wright-Phillips slipped behind the defense on a breakaway, pulling goalkeeper Evan Bush out to the top of the box, but couldn't convert either of two shots. 
The second, however, ricocheted back to Sam, who chipped over a scrambling Bush to make it 2-0 going into the half. 
Didier Drogba converted a penalty kick in the 67th for Montreal. 
STARS SIDELINED: Lionel Messi, Neymar, Luis Suarez and James Rodriguez will all be missing when 2018 World Cup qualifying gets under way in South America today. 
Messi is out with a left knee injury picked up on Sept. 26 and is not expected to return for Barcelona until late November. 
Neymar is suspended for Brazil's match against Chile and next week's qualifier against Venezuela.
